sermons.title: (Guidelines) Study the Bible
sermons.description: A simple straight forward plead to study the bible systematically, with diligence. He uses the account of Phillip explaining the scriptures to the inquisitive Ethiopian as an example as to why intelligent understanding of the bible is important.

sermons.title: 17 Principle 13 - A Growing Vibrant Movement
sermons.description: The early Church was a growing movement of multiplying house Churches.240 God was adding to the number daily such as would be saved241 and there were many being saved through the preaching of the Gospel. Radical evangelism was not an option in the early Church but the only logical response to the great offer of the Gospel of Jesus Christ. Not just a few but all the disciples242 were gripped with the burden to reach the whole known world with this message of eternal life.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 25 Principle 21 - Hungering After the True Holy Spirit Baptism
sermons.description: It was asked of one brother that travels amongst the house Churches in the Chinese Church and speaks with the underground leaders, â€œHow do the Chinese choose the leaders?â€ The answer was simple; the brother responded: â€œWhoever is the hungriest after God, they are the leaders.â€ Such a need is present in our time for more leaders who are hungry for the Lord and baptized in His Holy Spirit. There is a vast difference between one that seeks the Baptism of the Spirit simply for power377 and one that seeks to know the Lord intimately and desires to be His vessel, fully surrendered.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 29 Principle 25 - Not Judging Others
sermons.description: Many in our day will judge and consider a believer not saved or born-again if they do not meet a specific man-made standard. If a believer is not overcoming 100% in a specific area, or is partaking in some worldly activity, one may judge and claim that believer is not saved. Such merely outward judging is not spiritual but an immature and dangerous thing to do. Of course, if a believer is blatantly continuing in outward sin he must be dealt with in gentleness and love. As God taught us through the Book of Acts and Epistles of Paul, corrective measures as determined by the Holy Spirit might be necessary. This may include asking a believer to leave the Assembly for a period of time.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 40 Principle 36 - Dependence on the Moving of the Holy Spirit
sermons.description: In The Book of Acts the Church was birthed, led, sustained and grew in the power of the Holy Spirit. For many there is a hesitancy to speak much of depending radically on the moving of the Holy Spirit. Today for many sincere Bible believing Christians this terminology brings to mind many excesses of the worst kindâ€”whether itâ€™s the selfish seeking after the Spirit of God for a feeling,569 an anointing to enjoy for ourselves,570 some sort of extravagant healing such as gold in the teeth or other blatant extra-biblical manifestations that grieve the heart of God. The Devil our enemy always makes a pseudo571 of the genuine in attempts to deceive572 some and deter others. Some in these charismatic circles claim the Chinese Church is experiencing the same manifestations, but this is not true.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 49 Principle 45- Five Challenging Reminders
sermons.description: A young woman was washing clothes in a North Korean river. When gathering her clothes, a small Bible or Christian book fell to the ground. Another woman reported the girl to the police. The young woman and her fatherâ€”about sixty years oldâ€”were arrested and held by the local police for about three months. During that time, the woman and her father were investigated and interrogated. They were taken to a market area in town and accused of trafficking. A brief public show trial, was held which consisted of the charges. They were found guilty of a capital offense.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 61 Principle 57- Sharing the Faith Constantly in all Situations
sermons.description: Another Christian Pastor Farshid Fathi has been detained in prison since December 2010. He was charged with possessing religious propaganda. The evidence presented by the regime was that Pastor Fathi had Bibles printed in Farsi, that he had unlawfully distributed Bibles, and that he possessed Christian literature. The regime argued that his Christian activities were equivalent to actions against national security. Pastor Fathi is presently serving a 6-year sentence in Iranâ€™s notorious Evin prison. His crime is being a Christian and freely exercising his faith. Pastor Fathi has a wife Leila and two children, Rosana and Bardia. They suffer with him.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: Church History - Session 1 (The Book of Acts 2)
sermons.description: Parkyns wraps up his insightful commentary on the conversion of the Ethiopian in Acts 8 and digs out nuggets of truth from the salvation experience of Paul (Acts 9) and then Cornelius, the first Gentile Christian (Acts 10).  Parkyns shows both triumph and tragedy of the apostolic church, and how even Jesus’ best apostles can get put on the shelf through prejudice and delayed obedience.  He shows how God began to use insignificant men and the apostle Paul at Antioch to bring His promised blessing to the Gentile world.

sermons.title: HE WENT ON HIS WAY REJOICING
sermons.description: God’s greatest deed is that he sets us free from the burden of guilt in our lives, guilt that makes us unhappy and discouraged. sermons.title: Hindrances to Holiness
sermons.description: This is a powerful sermon leading us to full surrender to Jesus Christ and to experience the fullness of the Holy Spirit promised. Is there something in your life that is hindering God from using you today? on receiving the filling of the Spirit of God, and the hinderences to receiving that filling.

sermons.title: Releasing the Power of the Holy Ghost
sermons.description: We can not fight sin in our own flesh or power. Featuring scripture in Acts 8, this message reveals the main 3 things that will release the power of the Holy Ghost to overcome sin, the devil and the world, in every child of God. This overcoming power can be released in you.
